content.raw:
Could we include a little test more before merging?

```
#!diff
diff -r b761b1cf7176 test/integration/world.cc
--- a/test/integration/world.cc	Tue Oct 22 14:56:02 2013 -0700
+++ b/test/integration/world.cc	Fri Oct 25 22:54:55 2013 +0200
@@ -34,6 +34,11 @@
 
   EXPECT_EQ(world->GetModelCount(), 0u);
 
+  // Simulate a clear with no objects
+  world->Clear()
+  
+  EXPECT_EQ(world->GetModelCount(), 0u);
+
   SpawnSphere("sphere", math::Vector3(0, 0, 1), math::Vector3(0, 0, 0));

```

content.raw:
Fixed. No mutex necessary at this point. 

Case 1: User calls Clear, and clear is false. No problem.
Case 2: User calls Clear, ClearModels is entered and flag set to false. Result would be the models get cleared twice. No problem.
content.html:
Fixed. No mutex necessary at this point.

Case 1: User calls Clear, and clear is false. No problem. Case 2: User calls Clear, ClearModels is entered and flag set to false. Result would be the models get cleared twice. No problem.

content.raw: Since `Clear()` just sets a flag, this line can be executed before the models are actually cleared and cause the test to fail. We can probably just retry a fixed no. of times until we get 0, or somehow get feedback when the `World::ClearModels()` function has finished before checking the model count.
content.html: Since Clear() just sets a flag, this line can be executed before the models are actually cleared and cause the test to fail. We can probably just retry a fixed no. of times until we get 0, or somehow get feedback when the World::ClearModels() function has finished before checking the model count.

content.raw:
This method just sets the ClearModels flag to true. There's no guarantee that the models will be cleared before executing the next line.

In addition, should we use a mutex to protect this->clearModels?
content.html:
This method just sets the ClearModels flag to true. There's no guarantee that the models will be cleared before executing the next line.

In addition, should we use a mutex to protect this->clearModels?

content.raw: Should we initialize this->ClearModels to false in the constructor?
content.html: Should we initialize this->ClearModels to false in the constructor?

content.raw: Good point. I changed this up a little by moving the implementation of Clear to separate function that is called from the main update loop.The World::Clear function just sets a flag to indicate that models should be cleared.
content.html: Good point. I changed this up a little by moving the implementation of Clear to separate function that is called from the main update loop.The World::Clear function just sets a flag to indicate that models should be cleared.

content.raw: Do we need to lock any mutexes in this function? I suspect it depends on which thread calls this function.
content.html: Do we need to lock any mutexes in this function? I suspect it depends on which thread calls this function.

content.raw: I made a small update in 7ba4db0 to protect the pause state when World::Clear is called.
content.html: I made a small update in 7ba4db0 to protect the pause state when World::Clear is called.

content.raw: This function will over-ride the user's pause setting if it was paused when `Clear` was called. We should store the current pause state, then restore it at the end of the function. Not sure if any mutexes are needed.
content.html: This function will over-ride the user's pause setting if it was paused when Clear was called. We should store the current pause state, then restore it at the end of the function. Not sure if any mutexes are needed.

content.raw: Yes, that is expected since empty.world has a ground plane. Try "worlds/blank.world".
content.html: Yes, that is expected since empty.world has a ground plane. Try "worlds/blank.world".

I was adding an extra test to run Clear on a empty world.

TEST_F(WorldTest, ClearEmptyWorld)
{
  Load("worlds/empty.world");
  physics::WorldPtr world = physics::get_world("default");
  ASSERT_TRUE(world);

  EXPECT_EQ(world->GetModelCount(), 0u);

  world->Clear();

  EXPECT_EQ(world->GetModelCount(), 0u);
}

The first EXPECT is returning 1, is this expected?
